result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Christopher Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 90 days or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Christopher Mason

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adam Christopher Mason in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1 :
FINE: $505.00
Total amounts due to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 5 days Huber

Defendant Adam Christopher Mason in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has not been able to contact the victim.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Adam Christopher Mason did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defendant expects to complete treatment in about 8 weeks.  Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Adam Christopher Mason did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defense requests further proceedings date to allow defendant to obtain counseling.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Adam Christopher Mason did not appear.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huppertz to file authorization within 10 days.  Defense requests further proceedings date.  Defendant is in treatment.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness Jacquelyn D. listed in the criminal complaint   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness residence listed at 1169 Burr Oak Blvd in the City of Waukesha listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Adam Christopher Mason in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
